name: Universal Interview Prep
description: Core interview preparation content applicable to all positions

sections.title: Introduction
sections.exampleContent:
Welcome to Your Interview Journey

Congratulations on taking this important step toward landing your dream job. Whether you're a first-time interviewer or a seasoned professional, this guide will help you present your best self.

In the next few sections, we'll cover the fundamentals that apply to every interview, regardless of company or role. These timeless principles will serve as your foundation.

sections.title: Understanding the Interview Process
sections.exampleContent:
How Interviews Actually Work

Most companies follow a similar pattern: screening call, technical or skill assessment, behavioral interviews, and final rounds. Understanding this flow helps you prepare strategically.

sections.title: First Impressions
sections.exampleContent:
The First 5 Minutes Matter Most

Research shows interviewers often form initial impressions within the first few minutes. Here's how to start strong.

sections.title: Behavioral Questions 101
sections.exampleContent:
The STAR Method: Your Answer Framework

Behavioral questions (Tell me about a time when...) are universal. The STAR method helps you structure compelling answers.

sections.title: Common Pitfalls
sections.exampleContent:
Avoid These Interview Killers

Even strong candidates fail interviews by making preventable mistakes.

sections.title: Questions to Ask
sections.exampleContent:
Questions That Impress

Your questions reveal as much about you as your answers. Ask questions that show you've done your homework.

sections.title: Following Up
sections.exampleContent:
After the Interview

Send a thank-you email within 24 hours. Keep it brief, reference something specific from your conversation, and reiterate your interest.

sections.title: Handling Rejection
sections.exampleContent:
When You Don't Get the Offer

Rejection stings, but it's part of the process. Every no brings you closer to the right yes.
